column4: hello, my friend has an Asmax BR-604 router and he hasn't got connection to the internet; he already compiled drivers for his net card
we already looked for solution, but to no avail
sorry, I was away; he's trying to use wired connection
he should be able to plug it in and have it 'just work'. is there something weird about his network card? ubuntu 8.04 supports just about everything.
he did that and it didn't work
I found more people have problems with that router
maybe he should return it and get another? :/
his router works ok with Windows XP
I've just been told that his router sees his computer in dhcp clients, it can see his MAC address, but he can't connect to internet
can he connect his computer directly to internet without the router?
he tried connencting directly to modem and it didin't work - btw he doesn't need password to connect, so UbuDSL probably won't help here
why would it work in XP and not Linux I wonder?
maybe it's something with IP tables?
his router is 4 years old, maybe it doesn't support IPv6?
